🇬🇧🇭🇰 Watch the full video:

https://t.co/Y1ide75VQ2

Yesterday I visited the Ukrainian Social Club in London once again with Ambassador @VPrystaiko & his wife Inna to speak with members of the diaspora & the brilliant volunteers there. I’m in awe of their resilience and we will continue to do everything we can to support them. 🇺🇦🇬🇧 https://t.co/qIZOEju8Lc

As Home Secretary, tackling violence against women and girls is central to my Beating Crime Plan and I am doing everything in my power to target perpetrators, protect the public and make our streets safer for everyone. 

2/2

Sabina Nessa lost her life due to the harrowing & callous actions of a man who’s rightly now behind bars. 

While I can’t possibly know how Sabina’s family & friends are feeling, I hope today’s sentence brings them a small comfort, knowing this evil monster has faced justice. 1/2

Yuwing's tale is exactly why we launched the Hong Kong BNO visa – honouring our promise to the people of HK.

Proud of its success in helping families and talented, hard-working Hong Kongers start new lives here.

This is Global Britain in action.
Standing up for liberty.
🇬🇧🇭🇰👇🏽 https://t.co/mnFUR5cISF

Excellent work by Home Office Border Force officers & @NCA_UK on the largest cocaine seizure in the UK since 2015, keeping this 3.7 tonne haul worth £302m off our streets.

The Beating Crime Plan is protecting our communities from harm as we crack down on supply chains & gangs 👇🏽 https://t.co/fy0jqrlMVy

Delighted to meet with some of the many people working between the UK and India, and from the diaspora, at No10 today. From vaccine manufacturing to winning the Apprentice — there are amazing individuals with achievements across the Living Bridge that inspire us all. 
🇬🇧🇮🇳 https://t.co/GleLEhqEu7

"The people of the Falkland Islands...are few in number but they have the right to live in peace, to choose their own way of life and to determine their own allegiance." – Margaret Thatcher, 1982.

40 years on, we will still defend that right. 🇬🇧🇫🇰 https://t.co/yQXIoulygP
#RamadanMubarak to all Muslims observing the holy month here and around the world. I’d like to wish you and your family a very happy, peaceful and blessed Ramadan. https://t.co/r2apUnEZlT

Delighted to welcome Israel's Interior Minister 
@Ayelet__Shaked to the @UKHomeOffice this afternoon.

There are so many issues on which the UK and Israel can cooperate, not least in the global fight against terrorism, on which we stand shoulder to shoulder with Israel.

🇬🇧🇮🇱 https://t.co/iHWQZbTQc2

For far too long the focus has been on what the victim of domestic abuse might’ve done differently, instead of the behaviour of the perpetrators — this must change.

Read the full details of my new plan to tackle #DomesticAbuse 👇🏽

https://t.co/FyDxtZFR65

We owe an immense debt of gratitude to police officers like Simon and my thoughts and prayers are with his family at this difficult time. 

2/2

I am desperately saddened to hear about the passing of former Chief Constable Simon Cole QPM. He was passionate about delivering for the people of Leicestershire, the area where he grew up, and dedicated his life to policing. 

1/2 @leicspolice.

For far too long the focus has been on what the victim might have done differently, rather than on the behaviour of the perpetrators themselves.

This must change.
6/6

To read the full details of the Plan 👇🏽
https://t.co/SmLrws0Y0T

The #DomesticAbusePlan also intends to improve the systems and processes that underpin the response to domestic abuse across society – so we can save more lives. 

✅ This includes expanding the successful Ask for ANI codeword scheme, piloting it in Jobcentre offices.

5/6 https://t.co/77890w4w2w

✅ And funding 700 Independent Domestic Violence and Sexual Violence Advocate roles, with additional funding for 300 roles later this year to refer and support victims and survivors.

Supporting their health, emotional, economic and social needs.

4/6 https://t.co/1mE2PfbEjP

The #DomesticAbusePlan increases support to victims so they feel they can get back to life as normal.

This includes:

✅ Doubling National Domestic Abuse Helpline funding, which sees on average 15,000 users every 3 months & an uplift for all other tackling VAWG helplines.

3/6 https://t.co/x9XTNZgz4V

✅ We will be bringing forward plans for a new register for domestic abuse offenders and I continue to explore ways in which it can best protect those at risk.

#DomesticAbusePlan 
2/6 https://t.co/2dSfx8TEvZ

Today I have published a new #DomesticAbusePlan, which will:



👥 Take the onus off victims.
✅ Make it easier for victims to access the help & support they need.

🚨 Take tough action against perpetrators.
 
Some of the ways it will help tackle this devastating crime 👇🏽

1/6 https://t.co/1wiprb7SJ3

A hugely brave and courageous statement from my colleague and friend @JamieWallisMP. 

Jamie has my upmost respect, love and admiration. https://t.co/k5rZRpaKqY
I strongly condemn the attacks that we have seen today in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. These attacks endanger civilian lives and must stop.

Our Ukraine Family Scheme is helping bring loved ones together again here in the safety of the United Kingdom. https://t.co/i9KhiZhG9U

🇬🇧🇺🇦 We #StandWithUkraine and its people.

👇🏽

https://t.co/yZ1Hnm53Qd

20,100 Ukraine Family Scheme visas have been issued so far as we continue to help Ukrainian families reunite with their loved ones here in the UK, safe from harm.

🇬🇧🇺🇦 You can apply online for free here: https://t.co/zlhTFDdqC8 https://t.co/hkwY225Hjl

International allies must continue working together to denude Putin of his ability to wage his barbaric war. 

There must be coordinated and robust enforcement of sanctions and firm action to protect the integrity of international law enforcement tools from Russian abuse. 

2/2

Meeting of G7 Interior Ministers today to discuss our response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine — I set out the UK’s humanitarian response and our schemes to welcome Ukrainians to the UK & the various forms of aid we are sending to Ukraine and the region. 

🇬🇧🇨🇦🇺🇸🇫🇷🇯🇵🇩🇪🇮🇹🇺🇦
1/2 https://t.co/T1oqGEQq6k

52 children from @DniproKids have arrived in the UK to a safe & warm welcome. Huge thanks to my team @ukhomeoffice, the 🇺🇦 & 🇵🇱 authorities, @ScotGov & @VirginAtlantic who worked urgently on their swift arrival. The care they will receive will go some way to heal their suffering.

And on the Ukraine crisis we reasserted our abhorrence at Russia’s invasion, agreeing that the attack on a sovereign state is in clear breach of international law and norms and cannot be without consequences. 2/2

We #StandWithUkraine 🇺🇦

🇬🇧🇧🇪 Today I met with Belgium Interior Minister @AnneliesVl to discuss key shared challenges including illegal migration.

Through our partnership, Belgium will be introducing vital new security measures to help prevent Channel crossings and the work of people smugglers. 1/2 https://t.co/Oj0dywZiid

Tonight, Labour voted against our plans to tackle dangerous and illegal channel crossings. 

By cutting down on illegal migration we can better support those fleeing oppression, persecution and tyranny through our safe and legal routes. https://t.co/48yBNbhVlG

Earlier today, the Prime Minister & I, alongside the Leader of the House of Commons, laid white roses outside St Margaret’s Church following a memorial service to remember the heroic PC Palmer & all those who lost their lives on Westminster Bridge five years ago. #WeStandTogether https://t.co/FvmWIC4jAz

Five years ago today we saw a cowardly attack on Westminster. We commemorate those who were killed, those affected & their loved ones. We also remember the actions of the police, emergency services & the public who risked their own lives to help others. My thoughts are with them. https://t.co/K0YbddWHqK

Standards must be immediately improved.

I expect the Mayor of London and the new Commissioner to reverse these deficiencies as a matter of urgency.

The public put their trust in the police and expect them to carry out their duties to the highest professional standards.

2/2

I commissioned today's @HMICFRS inspection report to provide assurance that the Met had addressed historic failings in counter-corruption - and whilst it found some examples of impressive work, I am very disappointed that serious issues still persist. 

1/2

I had a productive and constructive call with US Deputy Attorney General Lisa Monaco earlier this evening. 

We discussed security threats linked to Russia, in particular relating to illicit finance and how we can tackle it through further UK-US cooperation.

🇬🇧🇺🇸

We want Ukrainian refugees to thrive here, just like the people we have welcomed from Syria, Hong Kong, and Afghanistan. 

They will have access to public services, from the NHS and specialist mental health services to education and benefits. 

🇺🇦🇬🇧
https://t.co/ba7mYXNn7b

Immensely proud to see the largest ever single donation of fire & rescue equipment leave the UK yesterday for Ukraine to support the heroic efforts of the front line as they continue to protect their country and people.

🇬🇧🇺🇦
@FIRE_AID_UK @NFCC_FireChiefs

https://t.co/Gdb3Xpt2Yf

We are determined to put an end to criminals who exploit our vulnerabilities in the cyber space. 

The @cyberawaregov campaign, which launched today, provides our citizens with practical advice on how to defend ourselves online.

➡️ Read more: https://t.co/whFF4vThNq

Today is the auspicious festival of #Holi, which in the ancient tradition signifies the victory of good over evil, and the arrival of spring with all its bright colours, as winter recedes. It is a time to make peace with one another. I wish you and your family a very #HappyHoli https://t.co/QT9rXJXDRh

I've been working with the Ukrainian government to help the children from the Dnipro Kids charity and am extremely grateful that we will now be able to bring them to safety in the UK. 

No child should be dragged into Putin's brutal invasion of Ukraine.

#StandwithUkraine

🇬🇧🇺🇦
This also happened to me earlier this week. Pathetic attempt at such difficult times to divide us. We stand with Ukraine. https://t.co/Lv5s2WtzyE

Most importantly, it was humbling to hear the personal perspectives of Ukrainian parliamentarians following Putin’s barbaric invasion of their country and to understand even better how international friends can help in their hour of need. Slava Ukraini! 🇺🇦🇬🇧

3/3

I talked them through the many actions the Home Office is taking to help the Ukrainian people right now, both in terms of aid on the ground and in the region, and through our Ukrainian Family Scheme which will reunite thousands of people with family members here in the UK. 

2/3

A privilege to welcome Ukrainian MPs @LesiaVasylenko @Aly_Shkrum, Olena Khomenko and Maria Mezentseva to the Home Office today. They know the UK stands shoulder to shoulder with the Ukrainian people and that the government is determined that Putin must fail. 

1/3🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/PmxJJJemQv

I’ve just met allies in a new int'l task force on sanctions enforcement on those linked to Putin. 🇬🇧 has sanctioned 1,000+ individuals/entities in relation to Russia’s violence in 🇺🇦 & there's renewed global resolve to cooperate on punishing the Kremlin for its abhorrent actions. https://t.co/Bh3wtzqzRz

Today I spoke to members of the UK & international security community at the 40th @UKHomeOffice Security & Policing Exhibition — outlining the severe, unprecedented action the UK is taking in response to Putin’s barbaric invasion of 🇺🇦 & protection of Ukrainians and our citizens. https://t.co/R78OuWoU26

Earlier I spoke to Romanian Internal Affairs Minister Lucian Bode @MAIRomania — We agreed on the need to provide steadfast support to the Ukraine government and the Ukrainian people, working together on security matters and on our humanitarian response to the crisis. 

🇬🇧🇷🇴🇺🇦

We're making these necessary changes to the Ukraine Family Scheme process to make it quicker & simpler, while vital security checks are still carried out. 

We continue to work with Ukrainian leaders & the diaspora community here who've been helping us develop the scheme 🇬🇧🇺🇦👇🏽 https://t.co/AiElFod7eX
The details in full: https://t.co/Zf0Ze3W2EV

There is no hiding place for Putin’s oligarchs in the UK as further shown by today’s sanctions against those who fund the Russia war machine.

We will continue to take the strongest possible action against those who enable unprovoked aggression in Ukraine. https://t.co/RfkighmRzX

🇬🇧🇺🇦 I have just announced changes to the Ukraine Family Scheme to make it quicker & simpler.

From Tuesday, Ukrainian passport holders won't need to go to a Visa Application Centre to give their biometrics before they come here.

Vital security checks will continue on all cases. https://t.co/G8hfEeQCNQ

An honour to hear President @ZelenskyyUa’s historic address. Thank you for your incredibly moving words. Before it, I signed the Book of Solidarity for Ukraine. We stand with you and the people of Ukraine as we provide them with sanctuary here in the UK. Slava Ukraini. 🇺🇦🇬🇧 https://t.co/HlCLF9NL48

Productive discussions with Slovakia's Interior Minister Roman Mikulec today on security & supporting Ukrainian arrivals fleeing across the border, as well as assistance we can provide Slovakia. We stand together for the Ukrainian people in this shared humanitarian effort.
🇬🇧🇸🇰🇺🇦 https://t.co/N3YAccFIX2

This afternoon I spoke to my Czech counterpart @Vit_Rakusan. We discussed how to help the many Ukrainians fleeing their homeland into the Czech Republic find sanctuary and reunite with family in the UK as quickly as possible through our visa application centre in Prague.

🇬🇧🇨🇿🇺🇦 https://t.co/SEDCMnQNqG

Earlier I spoke to Anna Revenco, Moldova's Minister for Internal Affairs, about Russia's barbaric invasion of their neighbours Ukraine & its impact on Moldova. We agreed on the need to protect our homeland security while doing all we can to help give safety to Ukrainians.

🇬🇧🇲🇩🇺🇦 https://t.co/hcSRi96WeJ

🇬🇧🇺🇦 The United Kingdom stands with Ukraine and is providing sanctuary to those fleeing their home.

At the @UkrEmbLondon & Ukrainian Social Club yesterday, I spoke with @VPrystaiko & the community about the support schemes we've announced to help people come to the UK so far 👇🏽 https://t.co/VOEQjbhLmd
2/ Russia’s actions are a direct threat to the safety of individuals and to international law enforcement cooperation.

1/ Alongside counterparts from 🇺🇸 🇨🇦 🇦🇺 and 🇳🇿, I have written today calling on @INTERPOL_HQ and its Executive Committee to take a decision this week, in accordance with its rules, on the immediate suspension of Russia’s access to its systems.

We’re extending the hand of friendship to thousands of Ukrainians. With our Ukraine Family Scheme, anyone from Ukraine with a close or extended family member here can apply, while our new sponsorship scheme will provide safety to those without family ties. https://t.co/il97nmVkuC

Alongside @VPrystaiko & Ukrainian faith leaders today I saw both the amazing work of volunteers at the Ukrainian Social Club in London and the sheer outpouring of solidarity from the British public who’ve been joining in our country’s humanitarian effort to support Ukraine. 🇺🇦🇬🇧 https://t.co/OfIWWGpszp

🇬🇧 Most significant economic sanctions on war criminal Putin & his cronies in history of any Govt.

🇬🇧 Essential aid, supplies & military support to 🇺🇦

🇬🇧 Family Scheme for immediate & extended family.

🇬🇧 Sponsor Scheme for those without family ties.

👇🏽
https://t.co/zDZNdIGa1L

While we want people to be able to return to their homes at the end of this diabolical invasion, giving thousands of people a route to safety in the UK, reuniting with their families, is absolutely the right thing to do.

Apply: https://t.co/i9KhiZhG9U
#StandWithUkraine 🇬🇧🇺🇦
2/2

Truly heartbreaking meeting families, women & children at the Poland-Ukraine border in Medyka who've been forced from their homeland by the monstrous Russian invasion. Our expanded Ukraine Family Scheme is now fully open and today I saw some of the first people who'll apply. 1/2 https://t.co/9GcB8PNPBz

The UK strongly supports #Ukraine and other international partners' request for Russia to be suspended from @INTERPOL_HQ systems.

We call upon INTERPOL to take urgent action.

#StandWithUkraine🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/UGvOhcElfm

Today I am in Poland to launch the United Kingdom’s Ukraine Family Scheme.

From today anyone settled in the United Kingdom can bring their Ukrainian family to safety.

The British Government is doing everything it can to support the Ukrainian people as they fight for freedom. https://t.co/Q6rbpEeHw1

The response of our emergency services, intelligence agencies, armed forces, & law enforcement staff was exemplary.

We will do whatever it takes to keep our country safe.

Today we stand united with the people of Ukraine, just as they stood with us then. 🇺🇦🇬🇧
#PutinMustFail

2/2

Today marks four years since Russia inflicted an appalling chemical attack on British soil in the city of Salisbury. It shook our whole country and united our allies in condemnation.

My thoughts remain with the people of Salisbury and of Amesbury, who lost one of their own.

1/2

I want to reassure people across the United Kingdom that I continue to prioritise tackling these abhorrent crimes, while encouraging the societal change needed to end them.
2/2

Today my thoughts and prayers are with everyone who knew and loved Sarah Everard. The circumstances of her death one year ago today were sickening. Our hearts are saddened by the grief of her family and friends.
1/2

I discussed with @AmbWilczek in particular how the UK can help those arriving in Poland from Ukraine. We agreed on the need for us to coordinate action on the ground, sensitive to the wishes of the Ukrainian people. 

(4/4)

Discussions also covered the need to keep homeland security at the forefront of our minds. 

(3/4)

The common thread throughout these conversations was to agree that friends and allies of Ukraine must speak with one voice following Russia’s horrific actions as we do all we can to support Ukraine and its brave people in their hour of need. 

(2/4)

Important meetings to discuss the situation in Ukraine with international counterparts today including US Homeland Security Advisor Elizabeth Sherwood-Randall, French Interior Minister @GDarmanin, Irish Justice Minister @HMcEntee & Polish Ambassador to the UK @AmbWilczek.

(1/4)

More details on the Family Visa Scheme and the new sponsorship route 👇🏽 

https://t.co/dttjAfjuiE

Yesterday I set out the 2nd phase of our 🇺🇦 Humanitarian Support Package:

🇺🇦 A free, expanded Family Visa Scheme so UK nationals & people settled here can bring a wider group of family members.

🇺🇦 A new sponsorship route for Ukrainians who may not have family ties to the UK. https://t.co/CM160NBoBd

🇬🇧🇺🇦 For all the details on our expansion of the UK’s Ukrainian Humanitarian Route: 

https://t.co/dttjAfjuiE

All the details on our action so far to support Ukrainians here and in the region👇🏽

https://t.co/NOrbQiOTCL

Announcing our new expansive Ukrainian Humanitarian Schemes 👇🏽

We will do right by the courageous people of Ukraine.

We will help British nationals & their families to get out of Ukraine safely.

We will support our displaced Ukrainian friends.

🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/12P7YRpTQU

This afternoon I hosted Ukraine's Ambassador to 🇬🇧 @VPrystaiko at the @UKHomeOffice. We discussed how the UK will best support Ukraine's interests through the Ukrainian Humanitarian Route, help to reunite families here and provide safety to the many thousands fleeing their homes. https://t.co/kqlOJ0IQeI

My statement from Parliament, in full 👇🏽
https://t.co/QocwiciwuX

Our Ukrainian Humanitarian Route will allow families to be reunited in 🇬🇧 & our bespoke sponsor route will give safety to Ukrainians forced to flee.

I've been talking to @VPrystaiko so that our humanitarian support is in Ukraine's best interests & reflects the asks of its Govt. https://t.co/11srOCywjP

For too long, the responsibility of keeping safe has been placed on the shoulders of women and girls.

This campaign says #Enough, and recognises it is on all of us to demand major societal change. Everyone has a stake in this.

Watch this 👇🏽

https://t.co/hziParefVq

Great to welcome Ümit Yalçın, Turkey’s Ambassador to the UK @TurkEmbLondon, to the @UKHomeOffice today.

United in our solidarity with Ukraine, we agreed on the importance of our countries’ continued cooperation, especially in the sphere of security and counterterrorism.

🇬🇧🇹🇷🇺🇦 https://t.co/08g8gzFoPl

What is happening in Ukraine is utterly heart-breaking and profoundly wrong. Together with our international partners, we stand with the heroic Ukrainian people.
🇬🇧🇺🇦

(7/7)

Finally, I have confirmed that the UK strongly supports the Ukrainian Government’s request for Russia to be suspended from @INTERPOL_HQ systems and I will be speaking to international counterparts to rally support.

(6/7)

I have also confirmed we will change our existing laws to allow visa penalties where a country has taken significant steps which threaten international peace and security; have led, or are likely to lead, to armed conflict; or breach international humanitarian law. 

(5/7)

I am committed to ensuring the UK is as generous as possible to the people of Ukraine, just as we have been to the people of Afghanistan and Hong Kong, and further announcements will be made in due course. 

(4/7)

All they need to do is pass biometric and security checks – there are no salary or language tests. Applications are being processed in just hours. 

(3/7)

It will enable Ukrainians permanently settled in the UK to stay. 

They and British Nationals can also bring their Ukrainian family here to seek sanctuary – which could see the UK welcome up to 100,000 people. 

(2/7)

UPDATE: Today I have confirmed the first phase of a bespoke humanitarian route for the people of Ukraine, which is responding directly to the needs and asks of the Ukrainian Government.

(1/6)

@DavidLammy David, Russia has invaded Ukraine. Of course the visa application centre in Kiev has closed. It is to keep staff and applicants safe. Our brilliant teams are working around the clock to process visas in several other - and safe - visa application centres nearby.
@KeeleyMP This is disinformation. Get the facts here: https://t.co/fnEZwluL71
@LukePollard Simply untrue. Get the facts here: https://t.co/fnEZwluL71

Appalling misinformation at a time of international crisis. 

This is simply untrue. 

Get the facts here: https://t.co/fnEZwluL71 https://t.co/9Gbbw9hU3p

I have cancelled the visas of the Belarusian Men’s Basketball Team who were due to play in Newcastle tomorrow night. 

The UK will not welcome the national sports teams of those countries who are complicit in Putin’s unprovoked and illegal invasion of #Ukraine.

We also discussed how our governments will continue to cooperate to protect the public from disinformation and any cyber attacks emanating from Russia in the current environment. 

3/3

We agreed it was vital that international partners continue to align their responses to the despicable actions of the Russian government in order to punish those responsible and demonstrate solidarity with the people of Ukraine. 

2/3

🇬🇧🇨🇦 Useful conversation today with Canada’s Minister of Public Safety @marcomendicino. I briefed him on the sanctions the UK is imposing on the Putin regime following the invasion of Ukraine & how we’ll prevent Putin’s associates from laundering dirty money through London.

1/3 https://t.co/vbx0FJgTxU

Уся інформація щодо зміни візового режиму:

https://t.co/kNHMabP6OW

Я дала розпорядження щодо негайного внесення змін до нашої візової політики, щоб дати певність нашим українським друзям та колегам, які живуть, працюють і навчаються у Сполученому Королівстві.

Ми стоїмо пліч-о-пліч з Україною.
🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/vBk2DLVkCC

Just spoken to Lithuania’s Interior Minister @ABilotaite. In sharing our outrage at Russia’s invasion of a sovereign country, we agreed on the importance of @NATO & #Ukraine’s other international friends & allies acting together to provide the support they need right now.

🇬🇧🇱🇹🇺🇦 https://t.co/mnwKZZJBnh

🇺🇦 The Visa Application Centre in #Lviv 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 for those eligible for a Family Migration visa.

Immediate family members of British nationals in #Ukraine wishing to apply should call +44 (0) 300 3032785 for assistance.

Full guidance: https://t.co/VrA1qVztMN https://t.co/KyXu5XsU8l

I was glad to be able to explain the raft of visa changes I have announced this afternoon for Ukrainians in the UK, providing reassurance and certainty to those currently living, working or studying here. 

We stand in solidarity with you. 
🇬🇧🇺🇦 

2/2

https://t.co/kNHMabxvqm

I’ve just spoken to Denys Monastyrsky, Ukraine’s Interior Minister. I reiterated our unwavering support for his country and its brave people following Russia’s despicable assault on their democratic right to exist. 

1/2 https://t.co/eMjZE4YYsg

📍🇺🇦 The #Lviv Visa Application Centre 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 for those eligible for a Family Migration visa.

📞 Immediate family members of 🇬🇧 nationals in #Ukraine wishing to apply should call +44 (0) 300 3032785 for assistance.

➡️ Full visa guidance: https://t.co/VrA1qVztMN https://t.co/DyBzFNBt82
All the details on today's visa concessions 👇🏽 https://t.co/kNHMabxvqm

I have ordered immediate changes to our visa policy to provide certainty to our Ukrainian friends and colleagues living, working and studying in the UK.

We stand shoulder to shoulder with Ukraine amid this unprovoked and antidemocratic act of Russian aggression.

🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/6GbtHifprF

Just spoken to EU Commissioner for Home Affairs @YlvaJohansson on Russia's unjustified attack on Ukraine. We agreed on more targeted action on individuals linked to Putin & his regime incl. EU passport & visa revocations to remove their right to automatically enter the UK.
🇬🇧🇪🇺🇺🇦

Be in no doubt there is work ongoing across government 24/7 to maximise our resilience to any such attacks, which would be met with a suitably robust response. 

(3/3)

As we monitor developments, we will be especially mindful of the potential for cyber attacks and disinformation emanating from Russia. 

(2/3)

Russia's unjustified and unjustifiable attack on a democratic sovereign nation makes this a dark day in Europe. The people of Ukraine have our unwavering support. 🇬🇧🇺🇦

(1/3)

A proud moment today as I met some of the @BritishArmy personnel who will benefit from our scrapping of visa fees 👇🏽

This change recognises the brave men and women across the Commonwealth, and the Gurkhas, who have served our country with distinction over many years. 🇬🇧 https://t.co/1tRPGLuPLA

The UK & Canada stand shoulder to shoulder in solidarity with the Ukrainian people, in defiance of Russian aggression.

Canadian High Commissioner @RalphGoodale and I discussed the troubling situation in Ukraine & agreed that Russia's actions must not be tolerated.

🇬🇧🇨🇦
United. https://t.co/Ro8KQ5LGbg

🇬🇧🇮🇳 Great to catch up with my good friend the High Commissioner to India, Gaitri Issar Kumar, once again. Thank you for our discussions on the India-UK migration and mobility partnership, and the safety of both our citizens amid the situation in Ukraine.

@HCI_London @UKinIndia https://t.co/nZDo2NHh9y

🇬🇧 Just announced: 

Today at @BritishArmy HQ, I confirmed we're waiving the visa fee for Commonwealth vets & Gurkhas with 6 years' service in the British Armed Forces who want to settle here.

It's only right that we support those who've done extraordinary work for our country. https://t.co/Q5nzDqJ3YO

Tonight I joined our trusted 5-Eyes partners who alongside 🇬🇧 represent a vital security alliance to help protect our homelands & stand up to aggressors.

Our response to Russia's deeply concerning actions in Ukraine will be united & robust.

🇬🇧🇺🇸🇨🇦🇦🇺🇳🇿
We all #StandWithUkraine🇺🇦 https://t.co/clZnu1QL8m
